intro: Microstegium rufispicum, commonly known as redstem sedges, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is native to eastern North America and is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and triangular cross-section. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in spikelets, and it produces small, three-angled berries. Microstegium rufispicum plays a role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
